embeds.title: Ghostly Presence
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 8 (10) **Block** :p_block:.
**Dead On:**
Apply 1 (2) **Weak** :p_weak: to ALL enemies.

messages.content: alt leg sweep gaming
best into late game where you can get 30 block out of it in value
also one of the few dead on skills
so it technically works on smoking barrel decks
I do not think smoking barrel is good btw

the floor for smoking barrel is it acting like a significantly better inflame for any deck that can use dead on every turn. Just getting 6+ damage out of it a turn is worthy of a 1 energy power and it can go up from there (most notably with ricochet).
have you considered
deadeye
run them both 🤷
or maybe don't put smoking barrel in your deck so you draw your enervates and deadeye faster
its just a 1 cost power its fine. really the only reason I would skip smoking barrel is if I feel like I have to many powers already (or if it just does not fit into the deck of course)
it's not like you need the damage provided by smoking barrel at all, you're hermit
like the ideal scenario is that you use it to get block on snapshot, but almost every single dead on card is an attack
and +4 block isn't that much when you get get permanent increases of block with deadeye
just getting 6 (or 8) vigor a turn is good flat value and theres like 5 dead on skills.
smoking barrel isnt supposed to be a demon form thats all of your scaling in one card; its just a damage boost thats easy to play.
you can boost your damage way easier without having to rely on a power, hermit is never even lacking damage in the first place
smoking barrel is a fluff card
deadeye quickly outperforms smoking barrel
you can't just hope to find dead eye every run and even a single copy isnt going to ramp fast enough.
they are both damage increasing uncommons that work within dead on and as such should be compared to eachother

and I've definitely used a copy of deadeye as scaling, so long as you have the other pieces of a dead on deck (enervate, eternal form, combo) it can and will give tons of strength every turn which ends up being enough block to win if you get online fast enough with power overwhelming and other acceleration cards
smoking barrel will only ever give a flat boost
smoking barrel doesn't have to be better then deadeye to be a good card in its own right.
like I think inflame is worse then spot weakness but I still respect inflame.
it has exactly one use where it is incredibly outperformed by another card in the same rarity
plus you are saying that deadeye out scales smoking barrel; but you have to play deadeye several times to achieve that. Which is an unfair comparison. Like the inflame vs spot weakness one.
of course the dedicated scaling card will do more damage then the one cost power
deadeye plays much nicer with all of the other pieces (combo, enervate, especially snapshot)
the permanent scaling on snapshot alone
I'm not expecting smoking barrel to be the run winner; its just a solid damage card you can use to get stronger. Having more damage is never bad for decks that have to kill the heart ASAP.
since when does the hermit need more damage ever, it's always been about not dying
cuz dead eye will just die when the heart decides to swing for 80 damage.
by the time that happens you should have combo / enervate + madness / whatever going on
and make a big snapshot and not die

dead eye related stuff is getting its block from snapshot (only works on 1 turn out of the 2 turns you are getting attacked on) and repeated use of block cards with combo (which is strong but will get outpaced).
the heart should be dead by then when you get to that point, if it isn't you wouldn't have made it to act 4
yes it should and smoking barrel is a card that can help you make it that far and still be live in that boss fight.
and you should be picking scaling and acceleration over flat damage as hermit 99 times out of 100
Smoking barrel is also really good into time eater since you can just kill him before he heals up (with something like ricochet, or a headshot)
since when has hermit EVER lacked flat damage
time eater matchup is just flash powder and or gestalt timed properly or madness enervate for perfect time warps
I would argue hermit struggles more with donu / deca because of the dazed being unplayable hurting dead on decks
combo / madness enervate is the easiest way to win with hermit and dazed make that harder
its always good to have more ways to get damage. The more options you have to take the more consistent the character iss
without smoking barrel more runs are just going to die before they see dead eye
I agree. Pure agrees. Guess it's on the hit list now.

while you are here I guess I should tell you that I while I was looking for inconsitencies in hexa's new art noticed that spite beta still has the attack border. weird thing to point out but I may as well
hopefully whatever change comes to smoking barrel, another change also comes to short fuse
I would love to see some cross synergy between strike and any of the other cards
imo strike / defend stuff should just be abolished. the whole strategy is to unreliable and if it was made good then hermit would be a really stupid character that just wins with his base deck.
strike is funny it just needs more variety beyond the high noon infinite, and reasons to run it beyond the high noon infinite
I don't disagree.
At this point it's not really something I can remove though.

hermits biggest issue is having so many things going on (that also clash ageist each other! )that it can be hard to piece together a deck in the early to mid game. Cutting out the strike/defend stuff would help clean up the clutter the character has.
If I had a chance to design hermit from the ground up again, I would definitely lose that archetype though.

I agree with this, curses and dead on mix like oil and water and the only card that interacts with both is midnight. Strike is an island in and of itself and self debuff / cost increasing is the only thing that tips its toes in multiple pools.
Also eh, easy fix I have all the masters lying around.

I think this is also a reason why people dislike cards like smoking barrel. Its going to be a skip in a lot of runs since you just don't have any dead on strategies going on; which makes the card feel worse then it acutally is.
in that sense smoking barrel is different from inflame since inflame is just a generic strength up that can fit into anything.
I would argue that brawl and deadeye are hermits generic strength ups
so even though smoking barrel is a much stronger version of inflame; it being more specific makes the card *feel* worse.
IC also has sword boomerang and hermit has spray n' pray with headshot being the "safer" option
oh well there's also magnum
can't forget magnum
oh ya this thread is about ghostly presence,
ghostly presence good
that card is pretty good because with combo you can get almost infinite aoe weak. You get 2(4) weak each time to see and play ghostly presence
combo needs a 4th energy or enervate support however
I would argue that its best for its act 2 and act 4 impacts
ghostly into tri slavers is strong
Sometimes you can take ghostly presence without combo or much dead on at all because weak is that valuable; but I tend to prefer glare instead if thats avaible first.
you cut like an extra 10 damage out
glare works as a 0 cost for dead on too
hermit acutally has pretty good aoe damage mitigation; something most downfall characters acutally don't have.
<glare> <taunt> <mini-curse> moment

although the boss characters can just get shockwave but better in most runs.
between the shop and the boss card event, <you are mine boss> is something that you can get pretty much every time

messages.content: while that is event tied I agree that card needs a nerf
its probably fine if it was just a shockwave reskin. I don't see why it needs remove block attached to an already good card.
you could easily remove the removing block bit, but I think removing block is kind of funny, you could bring that card into ic3 and remove a 100 block from him
obviously whats more important is just nerfing the sensory stone event to only give one boss card per "level" of damage opted into
so single card choices like suspicious merchant
because realistically, you are mine is not THAT crazy
I would argue that <automa-beam> is the better card for its dumb upgrade

messages.content: the rest are fine in the realm of being shop only or rare, or tied to a boss relic
hermit can acutally get automa-beam with the tiny bowler hat; it feels really weird having such powerful cards on him (I think this can be configured but its turned on by default).
making it so that tiny bowler hat can't give awaken anymore was already a big step to nerfing the boss cards
I remember I had a terrible deck and still won my run by just duplicate potion on my study the spire to kill the heart by just getting a bunch of cards I was not supposed to have
double your boss relic
or have forge potion
other than that the rest are fine
invincible could be turned into a rare but that's it
like make it expensive in shops
rest are fine
maybe buff the strength on shaper's power because 2 energy for 2 strength is sad
Hmmm have some ideas.

```Smoking Barrel: Whenever you draw a Status or a Curse card, Concentrate.
Take Aim: Whenever you trigger a Dead On effect, gain 1 Strength.```
take aim seems very good
smoking barrel seems worse then the current take aim, since it would be very hard to use its effect more then once a turn anyways
I like the idea of having status and curse concentrate so you can't brick a dead on due to those card, but it doesn't seem to stack well with itself and powers not stacking with themselves is strange
feels more like a relic than a power
Not any worse in that regard than current take aim.
well its worse because at best its the same card; but its more limited in the decks you can pick it in.
not that take aim is a card I pick that often anways
well no at best it's concentrate, but multiple times a turn
you would need to have a lot of curses in the deck + draw cards + dead on cards in hand to get that extra value though; quite a lot of steps.
could work on self debuff I guess? just a thought
I guess you could set it up with hermits retain skill
maybe that's too many things on one card though
alternatively concentrate could stack but that might be to good.
how would that work with spyglass
<spyglass>

embeds.title: Spyglass
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

If you end your turn **Concentrate** :p_concentration:d, gain an additional :energy_hermit:  next turn .
*Property of Kestin Highfin.*

messages.content: It used to, that's definitely not coming back.
~~DAMN NOW I HAVE TO CHANGE NICORETTE BARREL~~
Seriously though, these seem interesting

in terms of this card:
it's a good solid dead on block
This card is great
At worst its defend+ at best it defend+ and nonexhausting intimidate

Current take aim has a limitation of triggering at the start of your turn when it's highly likely that you already have at least one dead on card that you're able to play without needing  concentrate. Concentrate becomes more valuable with additional drawn cards since they'll be placed on the far right side of your hand so having an option to get concentrate later into your turn has its benefits.
Also having more support for curse/dead on hybrid decks is always exciting

As for ghostly presence, I take it less often than I probably should, much more often I'll be grabbing <plated armor skill common hermit> which gives you a promise of scaling defenses in a Dead on deck but hardly ever delivers on that

messages.content: dive only ever solves woke block
I find dive to be a pretty good option, as hermit lacks good defensive scaling in dead on decks. It's not much, but it can help.
Also with <scavenge> as well you can get to pretty decent numbers

embeds.title: Scavenge
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 4 (5) Plated Armor.
**Dead On:**
Gain 5 (10) Gold :p_gold:.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Probably one of the most important cards to land dead-on with. 8 (10) block is a decent rate, but nothing special, but applying 1 (2) AOE stacks of weak is very impressive, and really makes this into a premium defensive tool. The upgrade is usually a high priority, the extra turn of weak helps smooth out your mitigation between turns, and is pretty similar to upgrading your neutralize on silent, but you do need to make sure you are capable of landing dead-on frequently to get full value from the upgrade. Having two upgraded copies can apply near permanent weak on all enemies, which is very handy. Can be a useful role player in a smoking barrel deck, buying time while stacking up vigor, providing efficient offense and defense. Goes down in value if you already have multiple copies of glare, especially glare+, which is also an excellent source of weak. Try not to take this too early, its very bad into gremlin nob, sentries block the weak, and lagavulins debuff can overwhelm you when you play too defensively. I do like taking it once Im past gremlin nob to start preparing for act 2, especially in a guardian act where you can afford to build more defensively. In act 2 and beyond, I consider this a premium defensive tool, it just gets better and better as enemies start hitting harder. Can also be a useful tool to remove artifact charges and let you land your flash powder against multi-hit enemies.

For what it's worth, I've enjoyed smoking barrel a lot at lower ascensions, but it has really struggled to work at A20. There are a good number of defensive DO skills that you can pair with it to charge up vigor, and you also have a pretty good number of multi-hits (headshot, tracking shots, pray n' pray) as well as snapshot that can really benefit from timing the vigor well. The numbers on smoking barrel  just don't line up very well compared to deadeye, considering that it's only giving burst damage rather than permanent strength. I think the numbers used to be higher, and reverting that could help make it feel better again.

As for strikes/defends, I think that they could feel better overall if the support cards were more well rounded. High Noon takes up most of the power budget, and short fuse falls off too hard/has too much anti-synergy with everything else. Fully Loaded feels like it supports other archetypes better as a way to remove strikes/defends from the draw pile (especially for curse decks). I've liked showdown, high-caliber, and take cover a lot, and having ways to generate upgraded strikes/defends mid-combat is a direction I like. I think strikes/defends makes sense thematically for hermit (a lot of their identity is wrapped up in making things that would normally be bad for you better, like with curses and debuffing, and to some extent having to care about the position of cards in your hand).
